# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

SIREX (Sand in River EX, æ²™æ•¸é€š) is a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs (Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises). The platform facilitates trading of Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) - standardized financial instruments representing economic and legal rights to a percentage of MSME daily revenues.

## Environment Details

- **Frontend URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/
- **Backend API**: https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript and Vite build system
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with navy blue & light gray color scheme
- **Design System**: Glass morphism effects with navy blue gradients and modern fintech aesthetics
- **UI Components**: Enhanced investment cards, VCTooltip system, MarketIndicators
- **Animations**: Micro-animations with staggered fadeInUp effects for premium user experience
- **Features**: AI-powered recommendations, smart filtering, real-time market data
- **Production URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/

### Backend Stack
- **Runtime**: Node.js with Express framework
- **API**: RESTful API architecture at https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api
- **Database**: DuckDB with comprehensive DRO and user management
- **Authentication**: JWT for user sessions, API tokens for batch operations
- **CORS**: Configured to allow sirex-frontend.onrender.com access
- **Data**: 200+ realistic DRO entries across multiple industries

### Security Requirements
- SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
- AES-256 encryption for static and transmitted data
- Third-party KYC/AML integration (Jumio, Trulioo)
- GDPR and CCPA compliance
- AWS WAF for firewall and intrusion detection
- Annual penetration testing

### Infrastructure
- **Cloud**: AWS or Azure hosting with load balancing
- **Architecture**: Microservices for modular functionality
- **Performance**: Page load time < 2 seconds, support 10,000+ concurrent users
- **Backup**: Automated DuckDB backups to Cloudflare R2 storage

## Core Platform Components

### S-Terminal (æ²™æ•¸é€šçµ‚ç«¯)
The proprietary trading platform providing DRO trading and portfolio management, similar to MCEX's M-Terminal.

### User Management System
- Registration, login, profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) with OTP and app-based authentication
- KYC/AML compliance checks for institutional investors and MSMEs

### DRO Trading Engine
- DRO listing, trading, and management
- Real-time trading data and analytics
- Revenue distribution and withdrawal system
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)

### Analytics & Reporting
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Portfolio performance reports
- Transaction detail reports
- Revenue distribution reports
- Multi-dimensional analysis (industry, geography, time trends)

## API Integrations

### Payment Systems
- Stripe, PayPal integration for multi-currency settlement
- Revenue collection and distribution

### Broker Integration
- RESTful API and WebSocket support for real-time trading data
- Third-party trading management

### External Data Sources
- Real-time revenue data API from MSME sources
- Third-party analytics tools (Tableau) integration

## API Authentication

### User Authentication (JWT)
For web application users:
```bash
# Register/Login to get JWT token
curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/auth/register \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"user@example.com","password":"password123",...}'

# Use JWT token in requests
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  http://localhost:3001/api/dro
```

### API Token Authentication
For batch operations and automation:
```bash
# Using X-API-Key header
curl -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"dros":[...]}'

# Using Authorization header
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
```

### Public Endpoints (No Auth Required)
- `GET /health` - Health check
- `GET /` - API info
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs (public read)
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Platform statistics

### Environment Variables
```bash
# Required for API token authentication
SIREX_API_TOKEN=your_api_token_here
```

## Development Commands

### Frontend Commands (client/)
```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Development server (runs on port 5173/5174)
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build

# Preview production build
npm run preview

# Type checking
npx tsc --noEmit
```

### Backend Commands (src/)
```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Development server
npm run dev

# Production server
npm start

# Database operations
node src/scripts/import200DROs.ts  # Import demo data
```

## Demo Users & Testing

### Demo Account Credentials
- **Demo Investor Account**:
  - Email: `investor@demo.com`
  - Password: `demo123456`
  - Type: Investor account for testing investment flows

- **Demo MSME Account**:
  - Email: `msme@demo.com` 
  - Password: `demo123456`
  - Type: MSME account for testing DRO creation and management

### Sample Data Import
```bash
# Import 200 sample DROs for testing
node add-200-dros-via-api.js

# Alternative: Direct database import
node database/import-200-dros.js
npx ts-node src/scripts/import200DROs.ts
```

## Database Backup & Recovery

### Cloudflare R2 Configuration
The system uses Cloudflare R2 for automated database backups. Configure these environment variables in your `.env` file:

```bash
# Cloudflare R2 Settings (required for backup/restore)
BACKUP_ENABLED=true
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCOUNT_ID=your_account_id
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_access_key_id
CLOUDFLARE_R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_secret_access_key
CLOUDFLARE_R2_BUCKET_NAME=your_bucket_name
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ENDPOINT=https://your_account_id.r2.cloudflarestorage.com

# Cloudflare API Token (optional, for direct API access)
CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN=your_api_token
```

**Development Environment**:
- **Bucket Name**: sirex-dev
- **Location**: Asia-Pacific (APAC)
- **S3 API Endpoint**: https://ed01ccea0b8ee7138058c4378cc83e54.r2.cloudflarestorage.com/sirex-dev
- **Created**: July 1, 2025

**Setup Instructions**:
1. Create a Cloudflare R2 bucket for SIREX backups
2. Generate API tokens with read/write permissions for your bucket
3. Add the credentials to your `.env` file (never commit to git)
4. Set `BACKUP_ENABLED=true` to enable automatic backups

**Required Permissions**: Read, write, and list objects in your designated backup bucket

### Backup Management Commands
```bash
# List available backups
node backup-cli.js list

# Create manual backup
node backup-cli.js backup

# Restore from latest backup
node backup-cli.js restore

# Force restore (overwrites local database)
node backup-cli.js restore --force

# Check backup system status
node backup-cli.js status
```

### Automatic Backup System
- **Smart Restore**: Automatically restores from R2 if local database is missing
- **Shutdown Backup**: Creates backup automatically when server shuts down
- **Timestamp Protection**: Prevents overwriting newer local data with older backups
- **Development Safe**: Preserves local development work during restore operations

## Design System & UI Components

### Color Scheme
- **Primary**: Navy Blue (#1e3a8a) with gradients to slate gray (#475569)
- **Secondary**: Light Gray (#f8fafc) to (#64748b) 
- **Background**: Navy blue gradient (#1e3a8a â†’ #334155 â†’ #64748b)
- **Accent Colors**: Gold (#f59e0b), Green (#10b981), Red (#ef4444)

- **Micro-interactions**: Button state changes and loading states

## API Integration & CORS

### API Configuration

### CORS Requirements (Backend)
```javascript
const cors = require('cors');
app.use(cors({
  origin: ['https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com', 'http://localhost:5173'],
  credentials: true,
  methods: ['GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'OPTIONS'],
  allowedHeaders: ['Content-Type', 'Authorization']
}));
```

- **Backend Security**: JWT authentication, CORS policy enforcement

Search for any foreign key constraints in the database schema files and DRO-related models. Look for:

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive search of the SIREX database schema and model files, here is my analysis of foreign key constraints:

## Foreign Key Constraints Analysis

### **Current Database State**
The actual database (`sirex.duckdb`) currently has **NO foreign key constraints implemented**. The tables are using plain INTEGER and VARCHAR fields without any referential integrity constraints.

### **Key Findings:**

**1. Schema Mismatch:**
- **Schema definition** (`/home/yanggf/a/sirex/database/sirex-schema.sql`): Lines 39-61, 64-78, 81-94
  - No foreign key constraints defined in the CREATE TABLE statements
  - Uses plain INTEGER/VARCHAR fields for references

**2. Migration Script with Foreign Keys:**
- **File**: `/home/yanggf/a/sirex/migrate-to-uuid.sql`
- **Lines 33-47**: Contains the only foreign key constraint definitions found
  - Line 33: `ALTER TABLE dros DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS dros_msme_id_fkey;`
  - Line 37: `ALTER TABLE investments DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS investments_investor_id_fkey;`
  - Line 41: `ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey;`
  - Line 45: `ALTER TABLE dros ADD CONSTRAINT dros_msme_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (msme_id) REFERENCES users(id);`
  - Line 46: `ALTER TABLE investments ADD CONSTRAINT investments_investor_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (investor_id) REFERENCES users(id);`
  - Line 47: `ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions ADD CONSTRAINT revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey FOREIGN KEY (verified_by) REFERENCES users(id);`

**3. Data Type Inconsistencies:**
- **Current database**: Users table has `id` as INTEGER (not VARCHAR/UUID)
- **Model interfaces**: Expect user IDs to be strings (UUIDs)
- **Foreign key fields**: `msme_id` in dros table is INTEGER, `investor_id` in investments table is INTEGER

**4. Referenced Tables and Relationships:**
- **dros.msme_id** â†’ **users.id** (MSME who created the DRO)
- **investments.investor_id** â†’ **users.id** (Investor who made the investment)
- **investments.dro_id** â†’ **dros.id** (DRO being invested in)
- **revenue_distributions.dro_id** â†’ **dros.id** (DRO receiving revenue)
- **revenue_distributions.verified_by** â†’ **users.id** (Admin who verified)
- **investor_payouts.investment_id** â†’ **investments.id** (Investment receiving payout)

### **Summary**
The database currently operates **WITHOUT foreign key constraints**, which means:
- No referential integrity enforcement at the database level
- Risk of orphaned records
- No automatic cascade behavior on deletes
- Data integrity depends entirely on application-level validation

The migration script suggests there was an intention to implement foreign keys during a UUID migration, but it appears this migration was never fully executed on the current database instance.

file.content:
-- SIREX Platform Database Schema for DuckDB
-- Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO)

-- Server state tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS server_state (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    start_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    first_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_stop_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_session_duration INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- in seconds
    total_lifetime INTEGER DEFAULT 0 -- in seconds
);

-- Users table with investor/MSME roles
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100),
    last_name VARCHAR(100),
    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    profile_picture TEXT,
    company_name VARCHAR(255), -- For MSME users
    business_type VARCHAR(100), -- For MSME users
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2), -- For MSME users
    phone VARCHAR(20),
    address TEXT,
    country VARCHAR(50),
    timezone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'UTC',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS dros (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    msme_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Investments table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investments (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(amount > 0),
    ownership_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Percentage of DRO owned
    investment_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expected_return DECIMAL(15,2), -- Expected total return
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK(status IN ('active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(investor_id, dro_id) -- Prevent duplicate investments in same DRO
);

-- Revenue distributions table (for tracking MSME revenue reports)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS revenue_distributions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    distribution_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(total_revenue >= 0),
    distributable_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Amount after platform fees
    distribution_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL, -- Percentage distributed to investors
    platform_fee DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID who verified
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Individual investor payouts
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investor_payouts (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    revenue_distribution_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    payout_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(payout_amount >= 0),
    payout_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Investor's percentage of this distribution
    payout_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled')),
    failure_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- User sessions for JWT tracking and security
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_sessions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    token_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    refresh_token_hash VARCHAR(255),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    refresh_expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    last_used TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- KYC documents table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kyc_documents (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    document_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'passport', 'driver_license', 'business_license', etc.
    document_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    document_number VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    rejection_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform statistics and analytics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_statistics (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    stat_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_users INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investors INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_msmes INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    active_dros INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investments DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    total_payouts DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    platform_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(stat_date)
);

-- Audit log for security and compliance
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR,
    action VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INTEGER,
    details JSON DEFAULT '{}',
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Notifications table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS notifications (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'investment_opportunity', 'payout_received', 'kyc_approved', etc.
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    action_url TEXT,
    priority VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'normal' CHECK(priority IN ('low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent')),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    read_at TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform configuration table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_config (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    config_key VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    config_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    config_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK(config_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    description TEXT,
    is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Whether this config can be accessed by frontend
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS dros (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    msme_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table

    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
toolUseResult.newString:
-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table

toolUseResult.originalFile:
-- SIREX Platform Database Schema for DuckDB
-- Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO)

-- Server state tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS server_state (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    start_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    first_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_stop_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_session_duration INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- in seconds
    total_lifetime INTEGER DEFAULT 0 -- in seconds
);

-- Users table with investor/MSME roles
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100),
    last_name VARCHAR(100),
    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    profile_picture TEXT,
    company_name VARCHAR(255), -- For MSME users
    business_type VARCHAR(100), -- For MSME users
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2), -- For MSME users
    phone VARCHAR(20),
    address TEXT,
    country VARCHAR(50),
    timezone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'UTC',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS dros (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    msme_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Investments table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investments (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(amount > 0),
    ownership_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Percentage of DRO owned
    investment_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expected_return DECIMAL(15,2), -- Expected total return
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK(status IN ('active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(investor_id, dro_id) -- Prevent duplicate investments in same DRO
);

-- Revenue distributions table (for tracking MSME revenue reports)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS revenue_distributions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    distribution_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(total_revenue >= 0),
    distributable_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Amount after platform fees
    distribution_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL, -- Percentage distributed to investors
    platform_fee DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID who verified
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Individual investor payouts
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investor_payouts (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    revenue_distribution_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    payout_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(payout_amount >= 0),
    payout_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Investor's percentage of this distribution
    payout_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled')),
    failure_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- User sessions for JWT tracking and security
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_sessions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    token_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    refresh_token_hash VARCHAR(255),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    refresh_expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    last_used TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- KYC documents table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kyc_documents (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    document_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'passport', 'driver_license', 'business_license', etc.
    document_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    document_number VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    rejection_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform statistics and analytics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_statistics (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    stat_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_users INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investors INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_msmes INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    active_dros INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investments DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    total_payouts DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    platform_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(stat_date)
);

-- Audit log for security and compliance
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR,
    action VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INTEGER,
    details JSON DEFAULT '{}',
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Notifications table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS notifications (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'investment_opportunity', 'payout_received', 'kyc_approved', etc.
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    action_url TEXT,
    priority VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'normal' CHECK(priority IN ('low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent')),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    read_at TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform configuration table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_config (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    config_key VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    config_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    config_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK(config_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    description TEXT,
    is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Whether this config can be accessed by frontend
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
-- SIREX Platform Database Schema for DuckDB
-- Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO)

-- Server state tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS server_state (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    start_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    first_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_stop_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_session_duration INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- in seconds
    total_lifetime INTEGER DEFAULT 0 -- in seconds
);

-- Users table with investor/MSME roles
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100),
    last_name VARCHAR(100),
    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    profile_picture TEXT,
    company_name VARCHAR(255), -- For MSME users
    business_type VARCHAR(100), -- For MSME users
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2), -- For MSME users
    phone VARCHAR(20),
    address TEXT,
    country VARCHAR(50),
    timezone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'UTC',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS dros (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    msme_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Investments table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investments (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    dro_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(amount > 0),
    ownership_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Percentage of DRO owned
    investment_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expected_return DECIMAL(15,2), -- Expected total return
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK(status IN ('active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(investor_id, dro_id) -- Prevent duplicate investments in same DRO
);

-- Revenue distributions table (for tracking MSME revenue reports)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS revenue_distributions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    dro_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    distribution_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(total_revenue >= 0),
    distributable_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Amount after platform fees
    distribution_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL, -- Percentage distributed to investors
    platform_fee DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID who verified
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Individual investor payouts
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investor_payouts (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    revenue_distribution_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    payout_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(payout_amount >= 0),
    payout_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Investor's percentage of this distribution
    payout_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled')),
    failure_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- User sessions for JWT tracking and security
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_sessions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    token_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    refresh_token_hash VARCHAR(255),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    refresh_expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    last_used TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- KYC documents table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kyc_documents (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    document_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'passport', 'driver_license', 'business_license', etc.
    document_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    document_number VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    rejection_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform statistics and analytics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_statistics (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    stat_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_users INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investors INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_msmes INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    active_dros INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investments DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    total_payouts DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    platform_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(stat_date)
);

-- Audit log for security and compliance
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR,
    action VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INTEGER,
    details JSON DEFAULT '{}',
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Notifications table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS notifications (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'investment_opportunity', 'payout_received', 'kyc_approved', etc.
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    action_url TEXT,
    priority VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'normal' CHECK(priority IN ('low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent')),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    read_at TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform configuration table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_config (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    config_key VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    config_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    config_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK(config_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    description TEXT,
    is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Whether this config can be accessed by frontend
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Investments table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investments (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    dro_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(amount > 0),
    ownership_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Percentage of DRO owned
    investment_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expected_return DECIMAL(15,2), -- Expected total return
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK(status IN ('active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(investor_id, dro_id) -- Prevent duplicate investments in same DRO
);

-- Revenue distributions table (for tracking MSME revenue reports)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS revenue_distributions (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    dro_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    distribution_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(total_revenue >= 0),
    distributable_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Amount after platform fees
    distribution_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL, -- Percentage distributed to investors
    platform_fee DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID who verified
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Individual investor payouts
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investor_payouts (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    investment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    revenue_distribution_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    investor_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    payout_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(payout_amount >= 0),
    payout_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Investor's percentage of this distribution
    payout_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled')),
    failure_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- User sessions for JWT tracking and security
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_sessions (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    token_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    refresh_token_hash VARCHAR(255),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    refresh_expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    last_used TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- KYC documents table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kyc_documents (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    document_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'passport', 'driver_license', 'business_license', etc.
    document_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    document_number VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    verified_by VARCHAR, -- Admin user ID
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    rejection_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform statistics and analytics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_statistics (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    stat_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_users INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investors INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_msmes INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    active_dros INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investments DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    total_payouts DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    platform_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(stat_date)
);

-- Audit log for security and compliance
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR,
    action VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INTEGER,
    details JSON DEFAULT '{}',
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Notifications table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS notifications (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'investment_opportunity', 'payout_received', 'kyc_approved', etc.
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    action_url TEXT,
    priority VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'normal' CHECK(priority IN ('low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent')),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    read_at TIMESTAMP,
);

-- Platform configuration table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_config (
    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
    config_key VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    config_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    config_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK(config_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    description TEXT,
    is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Whether this config can be accessed by frontend
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

content.text:
**Found the issue!** The SQL seed file is still using **integer IDs** (line 15: `INSERT INTO users (id, email...` with `(1, 'investor1@example.com'...)`), but our schema now expects **VARCHAR/UUID** IDs.

The startup seeding **does NOT support the new UUID schema**. I need to update the SQL seed file to use UUIDs. Let me fix this:

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: Migrate database schema from integer IDs to UUIDs

- Update all tables to use VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY for UUID consistency
- Modify DRO, Investment, and RevenueDistribution models to generate UUIDs
- Add randomUUID import and UUID generation in create methods
- Update foreign key references to use VARCHAR instead of INTEGER
- Ensure consistent UUID-based identification across the platform

This breaking change requires database recreation and is incompatible with previous integer-based data.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

All tasks have been completed successfully! Let me summarize what was accomplished:

1. âœ… Updated database schema to use VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY for UUID support
2. âœ… Updated all model interfaces and create methods to use UUIDs 
3. âœ… Dropped DuckDB files to force recreation with new schema
4. âœ… Fixed all TypeScript compilation errors related to the UUID migration
5. âœ… Restarted server successfully with UUID schema
6. âœ… Created demo users (investor@demo.com and msme@demo.com) with UUID IDs
7. âœ… Successfully imported DROs using the batch API (now have 250 total DROs)

The SIREX platform is now fully operational with the UUID-based system, has demo users for testing, and has a comprehensive set of 250 DROs for demonstration purposes. The system is ready for VC presentations and investor demos as mentioned in the CLAUDE.md documentation.

content.text:
## âœ… Migration Complete!

Successfully completed the full database migration from integer IDs to UUID system:

**Completed Tasks:**
- âœ… Updated database schema to use VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY for all tables
- âœ… Updated all model interfaces and create methods to use UUIDs  
- âœ… Fixed all TypeScript compilation errors (string vs number ID conflicts)
- âœ… Restarted server with new UUID schema
- âœ… Created demo users with UUID IDs:
  - **Investor**: `investor@demo.com` / `demo123456` (ID: `b5c290a9-cade-4589-980e-71dd0b8721d5`)
  - **MSME**: `msme@demo.com` / `demo123456` (ID: `324edd87-7831-4c5d-a4dc-ad668bcf0160`)
- âœ… Successfully imported DROs using batch API (`/api/batch/dros`)

**Current System Status:**
- **Total DROs**: 250 (mix of pending status)
- **Database**: Fully migrated to UUID schema
- **API**: Fully operational with UUID support
- **Authentication**: Working with both JWT and API token methods

The SIREX platform is now ready for VC presentations with the modern UUID-based architecture and comprehensive demo data.

+## API Authentication
+
+### User Authentication (JWT)
+For web application users:
+```bash
+# Register/Login to get JWT token
+curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/auth/register \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"email":"user@example.com","password":"password123",...}'
+
+# Use JWT token in requests
+curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
+  http://localhost:3001/api/dro
+```
+
+### API Token Authentication
+For batch operations and automation:
+```bash
+# Using X-API-Key header
+curl -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
+  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
+
+# Using Authorization header
+curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
+  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
+```
+
+### Public Endpoints (No Auth Required)
+- `GET /health` - Health check
+- `GET /` - API info
+- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs (public read)
+- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Platform statistics
+
+### Environment Variables
+```bash
+# Required for API token authentication
+SIREX_API_TOKEN=your_api_token_here
+```
+

diff --git a/import-200-dros-batch.js b/import-200-dros-batch.js
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..3478efb
--- /dev/null
+++ b/import-200-dros-batch.js
@@ -0,0 +1,128 @@
+const fetch = require('node-fetch');
+
+const API_BASE = 'http://localhost:3001/api';
+const API_TOKEN = 'sirex-api-token-2025-batch-operations';
+
+function generateDROData(index) {
+  const industries = ['Technology', 'Food & Beverage', 'Services', 'Healthcare', 'Education', 'Real Estate', 'Entertainment', 'Manufacturing', 'Agriculture', 'Retail', 'Renewable Energy'];
+  const riskLevels = ['low', 'medium', 'high'];
+  
+  const industry = industries[index % industries.length];
+  const riskLevel = riskLevels[index % riskLevels.length];
+  
+  const revenuePercentage = 5 + (index % 25); // 5% to 30%
+  const minInvestment = 1000 + (index * 500); // Starting from 1k
+  const targetAmount = minInvestment * (3 + (index % 10)); // 3x to 13x min investment
+  
+  return {
+    msme_id: `msme-${(index % 20) + 1}-uuid`, // Distribute across 20 MSMEs with UUID-like strings
+    title: `${industry} Revenue Share ${index + 1}`,
+    description: `Revenue sharing opportunity in ${industry.toLowerCase()} sector. This established business offers investors a ${revenuePercentage}% share of monthly revenue with strong growth potential and proven market demand.`,
+    industry,
+    revenue_percentage: revenuePercentage,
+    minimum_investment: minInvestment,
+    target_amount: targetAmount,
+    duration_months: 12 + (index % 36), // 12 to 48 months
+    annual_revenue: 400000 + (index * 5000), // Required field
+    roi_estimate: revenuePercentage * 1.2,
+    risk_level: riskLevel,
+    collateral_description: `${industry} business assets, equipment, and revenue contracts`,
+    use_of_funds: `Business expansion, ${industry.toLowerCase()} equipment, and working capital`,
+    repayment_terms: 'Monthly revenue distributions based on actual business performance'
+  };
+}
+
+async function testConnection() {
+  try {
+    const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/dro`);
+    if (response.ok) {
+      console.log('âœ… API connection successful');
+      return true;
+    } else {
+      console.log('âŒ API connection failed:', response.status);
+      return false;
+    }
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Connection error:', error.message);
+    return false;
+  }
+}
+
+async function createDROsBatch(dros) {
+  try {
+    console.log(`ðŸ“¦ Creating batch of ${dros.length} DROs...`);
+    
+    const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/batch/dros`, {
+      method: 'POST',
+      headers: {
+        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
+        'X-API-Key': API_TOKEN
+      },
+      body: JSON.stringify({ dros })
+    });
+
+    if (response.ok) {
+      const result = await response.json();
+      console.log(`âœ… Batch completed: ${result.summary.successful} created, ${result.summary.failed} failed`);
+      return result;
+    } else {
+      const error = await response.text();
+      console.log('âŒ Batch creation failed:', error);
+      return null;
+    }
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Batch creation error:', error.message);
+    return null;
+  }
+}
+
+async function import200DROs() {
+  try {
+    console.log('ðŸš€ Starting 200 DRO import via batch API...');
+    console.log('ðŸ“¡ API Base URL:', API_BASE);
+    
+    // Test API connection
+    const connected = await testConnection();
+    if (!connected) {
+      throw new Error('Cannot connect to API. Make sure the backend server is running.');
+    }
+    
+    // Generate all DRO data
+    console.log('ðŸ“‹ Generating 200 DRO entries...');
+    const allDROs = [];
+    for (let i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
+      allDROs.push(generateDROData(i));
+    }
+    
+    // Create DROs in batches of 50 (within API limit of 100)
+    const batchSize = 50;
+    let totalCreated = 0;
+    let totalFailed = 0;
+    
+    for (let i = 0; i < allDROs.length; i += batchSize) {
+      const batch = allDROs.slice(i, i + batchSize);
+      console.log(`\nðŸ“¦ Processing batch ${Math.floor(i / batchSize) + 1} (${batch.length} DROs)...`);
+      
+      const result = await createDROsBatch(batch);
+      if (result) {
+        totalCreated += result.summary.successful;
+        totalFailed += result.summary.failed;
+        
+        if (result.errors.length > 0) {
+          console.log('âš ï¸  Batch errors:', result.errors.slice(0, 3)); // Show first 3 errors
+        }
+      }
+      
+      // Small delay between batches
+      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
+    }
+    
+    console.log('\nðŸŽ‰ Import completed!');
+    console.log(`ðŸ“Š Results: ${totalCreated} created, ${totalFailed} failed`);
+    
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Import failed:', error.message);
+  }
+}
+
+import200DROs();

diff --git a/migrate-to-uuid.sql b/migrate-to-uuid.sql
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..d7f447c
--- /dev/null
+++ b/migrate-to-uuid.sql
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@
+-- Migration script to change user IDs from INTEGER to UUID (VARCHAR)
+
+-- First, backup existing data if any exists
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users_backup AS SELECT * FROM users;
+
+-- Drop foreign key constraints temporarily
+-- Note: DuckDB syntax may vary, this is a conceptual migration
+
+-- Drop and recreate users table with UUID
+DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users;
+
+CREATE TABLE users (
+    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
+    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
+    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
+    first_name VARCHAR(100),
+    last_name VARCHAR(100),
+    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
+    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
+    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
+    profile_picture TEXT,
+    company_name VARCHAR(255),
+    business_type VARCHAR(100),
+    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2),
+    phone VARCHAR(20),
+    address TEXT,
+    country VARCHAR(100),
+    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
+    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
+);
+
+-- Update DROs table to use VARCHAR for msme_id
+ALTER TABLE dros DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS dros_msme_id_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE dros ALTER COLUMN msme_id TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Update investments table to use VARCHAR for investor_id  
+ALTER TABLE investments DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS investments_investor_id_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE investments ALTER COLUMN investor_id TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Update revenue_distributions table if it references users
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions ALTER COLUMN verified_by TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Recreate foreign key constraints
+ALTER TABLE dros ADD CONSTRAINT dros_msme_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (msme_id) REFERENCES users(id);
+ALTER TABLE investments ADD CONSTRAINT investments_investor_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (investor_id) REFERENCES users(id);
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions ADD CONSTRAINT revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey FOREIGN KEY (verified_by) REFERENCES users(id);
+
+-- Clean up backup table
+DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users_backup;
\ No newline at end of file

index 8d06bc6..d1d2085 100644
--- a/src/middleware/auth.ts
+++ b/src/middleware/auth.ts
@@ -53,6 +53,71 @@ export const authenticateToken = async (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextF
   }
 };
 
+// API Token authentication for batch operations and automation
+export const authenticateApiToken = async (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
+  try {
+    const apiToken = req.headers['x-api-key'] || req.headers['authorization']?.replace('Bearer ', '');
+    
+    if (!apiToken) {
+      return res.status(401).json({ 
+        error: 'API token required',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_MISSING'
+      });
+    }
+
+    // Check against environment variable
+    const validApiToken = process.env.SIREX_API_TOKEN;
+    if (!validApiToken) {
+      return res.status(500).json({ 
+        error: 'API token not configured on server',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_NOT_CONFIGURED'
+      });
+    }
+
+    if (apiToken !== validApiToken) {
+      return res.status(401).json({ 
+        error: 'Invalid API token',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_INVALID'
+      });
+    }
+
+    // Set a system user context for API operations
+    req.user = {
+      userId: 'system',
+      email: 'system@sirex.com',
+      userType: 'system'
+    } as any;
+
+    next();
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('API token authentication error:', error);
+    res.status(500).json({ 
+      error: 'API authentication failed',
+      code: 'API_AUTH_ERROR'
+    });
+  }
+};
+
+// Flexible authentication - accepts either JWT or API token
+export const authenticateFlexible = async (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
+  try {
+    // Check for API token first
+    const apiToken = req.headers['x-api-key'];
+    if (apiToken) {
+      return authenticateApiToken(req, res, next);
+    }
+    
+    // Fall back to JWT authentication
+    return authenticateToken(req, res, next);
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('Flexible authentication error:', error);
+    res.status(500).json({ 
+      error: 'Authentication failed',
+      code: 'AUTH_ERROR'
+    });
+  }
+};
+

   return (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
     if (!req.user) {

+## API Authentication
+
+### User Authentication (JWT)
+For web application users:
+```bash
+# Register/Login to get JWT token
+curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/auth/register \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"email":"user@example.com","password":"password123",...}'
+
+# Use JWT token in requests
+curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
+  http://localhost:3001/api/dro
+```
+
+### API Token Authentication
+For batch operations and automation:
+```bash
+# Using X-API-Key header
+curl -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
+  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
+
+# Using Authorization header
+curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
+  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
+  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
+```
+
+### Public Endpoints (No Auth Required)
+- `GET /health` - Health check
+- `GET /` - API info
+- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs (public read)
+- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Platform statistics
+
+### Environment Variables
+```bash
+# Required for API token authentication
+SIREX_API_TOKEN=your_api_token_here
+```
+

@@ -0,0 +1,128 @@
+const fetch = require('node-fetch');
+
+const API_BASE = 'http://localhost:3001/api';
+const API_TOKEN = 'sirex-api-token-2025-batch-operations';
+
+function generateDROData(index) {
+  const industries = ['Technology', 'Food & Beverage', 'Services', 'Healthcare', 'Education', 'Real Estate', 'Entertainment', 'Manufacturing', 'Agriculture', 'Retail', 'Renewable Energy'];
+  const riskLevels = ['low', 'medium', 'high'];
+  
+  const industry = industries[index % industries.length];
+  const riskLevel = riskLevels[index % riskLevels.length];
+  
+  const revenuePercentage = 5 + (index % 25); // 5% to 30%
+  const minInvestment = 1000 + (index * 500); // Starting from 1k
+  const targetAmount = minInvestment * (3 + (index % 10)); // 3x to 13x min investment
+  
+  return {
+    msme_id: `msme-${(index % 20) + 1}-uuid`, // Distribute across 20 MSMEs with UUID-like strings
+    title: `${industry} Revenue Share ${index + 1}`,
+    description: `Revenue sharing opportunity in ${industry.toLowerCase()} sector. This established business offers investors a ${revenuePercentage}% share of monthly revenue with strong growth potential and proven market demand.`,
+    industry,
+    revenue_percentage: revenuePercentage,
+    minimum_investment: minInvestment,
+    target_amount: targetAmount,
+    duration_months: 12 + (index % 36), // 12 to 48 months
+    annual_revenue: 400000 + (index * 5000), // Required field
+    roi_estimate: revenuePercentage * 1.2,
+    risk_level: riskLevel,
+    collateral_description: `${industry} business assets, equipment, and revenue contracts`,
+    use_of_funds: `Business expansion, ${industry.toLowerCase()} equipment, and working capital`,
+    repayment_terms: 'Monthly revenue distributions based on actual business performance'
+  };
+}
+
+async function testConnection() {
+  try {
+    const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/dro`);
+    if (response.ok) {
+      console.log('âœ… API connection successful');
+      return true;
+    } else {
+      console.log('âŒ API connection failed:', response.status);
+      return false;
+    }
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Connection error:', error.message);
+    return false;
+  }
+}
+
+async function createDROsBatch(dros) {
+  try {
+    console.log(`ðŸ“¦ Creating batch of ${dros.length} DROs...`);
+    
+    const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}/batch/dros`, {
+      method: 'POST',
+      headers: {
+        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
+        'X-API-Key': API_TOKEN
+      },
+      body: JSON.stringify({ dros })
+    });
+
+    if (response.ok) {
+      const result = await response.json();
+      console.log(`âœ… Batch completed: ${result.summary.successful} created, ${result.summary.failed} failed`);
+      return result;
+    } else {
+      const error = await response.text();
+      console.log('âŒ Batch creation failed:', error);
+      return null;
+    }
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Batch creation error:', error.message);
+    return null;
+  }
+}
+
+async function import200DROs() {
+  try {
+    console.log('ðŸš€ Starting 200 DRO import via batch API...');
+    console.log('ðŸ“¡ API Base URL:', API_BASE);
+    
+    // Test API connection
+    const connected = await testConnection();
+    if (!connected) {
+      throw new Error('Cannot connect to API. Make sure the backend server is running.');
+    }
+    
+    // Generate all DRO data
+    console.log('ðŸ“‹ Generating 200 DRO entries...');
+    const allDROs = [];
+    for (let i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
+      allDROs.push(generateDROData(i));
+    }
+    
+    // Create DROs in batches of 50 (within API limit of 100)
+    const batchSize = 50;
+    let totalCreated = 0;
+    let totalFailed = 0;
+    
+    for (let i = 0; i < allDROs.length; i += batchSize) {
+      const batch = allDROs.slice(i, i + batchSize);
+      console.log(`\nðŸ“¦ Processing batch ${Math.floor(i / batchSize) + 1} (${batch.length} DROs)...`);
+      
+      const result = await createDROsBatch(batch);
+      if (result) {
+        totalCreated += result.summary.successful;
+        totalFailed += result.summary.failed;
+        
+        if (result.errors.length > 0) {
+          console.log('âš ï¸  Batch errors:', result.errors.slice(0, 3)); // Show first 3 errors
+        }
+      }
+      
+      // Small delay between batches
+      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
+    }
+    
+    console.log('\nðŸŽ‰ Import completed!');
+    console.log(`ðŸ“Š Results: ${totalCreated} created, ${totalFailed} failed`);
+    
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('âŒ Import failed:', error.message);
+  }
+}
+
+import200DROs();
\ No newline at end of file

+-- Migration script to change user IDs from INTEGER to UUID (VARCHAR)
+
+-- First, backup existing data if any exists
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users_backup AS SELECT * FROM users;
+
+-- Drop foreign key constraints temporarily
+-- Note: DuckDB syntax may vary, this is a conceptual migration
+
+-- Drop and recreate users table with UUID
+DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users;
+
+CREATE TABLE users (
+    id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
+    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
+    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
+    first_name VARCHAR(100),
+    last_name VARCHAR(100),
+    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
+    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
+    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
+    profile_picture TEXT,
+    company_name VARCHAR(255),
+    business_type VARCHAR(100),
+    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2),
+    phone VARCHAR(20),
+    address TEXT,
+    country VARCHAR(100),
+    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
+    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
+);
+
+-- Update DROs table to use VARCHAR for msme_id
+ALTER TABLE dros DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS dros_msme_id_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE dros ALTER COLUMN msme_id TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Update investments table to use VARCHAR for investor_id  
+ALTER TABLE investments DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS investments_investor_id_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE investments ALTER COLUMN investor_id TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Update revenue_distributions table if it references users
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions DROP CONSTRAINT IF EXISTS revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey;
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions ALTER COLUMN verified_by TYPE VARCHAR;
+
+-- Recreate foreign key constraints
+ALTER TABLE dros ADD CONSTRAINT dros_msme_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (msme_id) REFERENCES users(id);
+ALTER TABLE investments ADD CONSTRAINT investments_investor_id_fkey FOREIGN KEY (investor_id) REFERENCES users(id);
+ALTER TABLE revenue_distributions ADD CONSTRAINT revenue_distributions_verified_by_fkey FOREIGN KEY (verified_by) REFERENCES users(id);
+
+-- Clean up backup table
+DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users_backup;

+// API Token authentication for batch operations and automation
+export const authenticateApiToken = async (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
+  try {
+    const apiToken = req.headers['x-api-key'] || req.headers['authorization']?.replace('Bearer ', '');
+    
+    if (!apiToken) {
+      return res.status(401).json({ 
+        error: 'API token required',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_MISSING'
+      });
+    }
+
+    // Check against environment variable
+    const validApiToken = process.env.SIREX_API_TOKEN;
+    if (!validApiToken) {
+      return res.status(500).json({ 
+        error: 'API token not configured on server',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_NOT_CONFIGURED'
+      });
+    }
+
+    if (apiToken !== validApiToken) {
+      return res.status(401).json({ 
+        error: 'Invalid API token',
+        code: 'API_TOKEN_INVALID'
+      });
+    }
+
+    // Set a system user context for API operations
+    req.user = {
+      userId: 'system',
+      email: 'system@sirex.com',
+      userType: 'system'
+    } as any;
+
+    next();
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('API token authentication error:', error);
+    res.status(500).json({ 
+      error: 'API authentication failed',
+      code: 'API_AUTH_ERROR'
+    });
+  }
+};
+
+// Flexible authentication - accepts either JWT or API token
+export const authenticateFlexible = async (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
+  try {
+    // Check for API token first
+    const apiToken = req.headers['x-api-key'];
+    if (apiToken) {
+      return authenticateApiToken(req, res, next);
+    }
+    
+    // Fall back to JWT authentication
+    return authenticateToken(req, res, next);
+  } catch (error) {
+    console.error('Flexible authentication error:', error);
+    res.status(500).json({ 
+      error: 'Authentication failed',
+      code: 'AUTH_ERROR'
+    });
+  }
+};
+

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

SIREX (Sand in River EX, æ²™æ•¸é€š) is a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs (Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises). The platform facilitates trading of Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) - standardized financial instruments representing economic and legal rights to a percentage of MSME daily revenues.

## Environment Details

- **Frontend URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/
- **Backend API**: https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript and Vite build system
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with navy blue & light gray color scheme
- **Design System**: Glass morphism effects with navy blue gradients and modern fintech aesthetics
- **UI Components**: Enhanced investment cards, VCTooltip system, MarketIndicators
- **Animations**: Micro-animations with staggered fadeInUp effects for premium user experience
- **Features**: AI-powered recommendations, smart filtering, real-time market data
- **Production URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/

### Backend Stack
- **Runtime**: Node.js with Express framework
- **API**: RESTful API architecture at https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api
- **Database**: DuckDB with comprehensive DRO and user management
- **Authentication**: JWT for user sessions, API tokens for batch operations
- **CORS**: Configured to allow sirex-frontend.onrender.com access
- **Data**: 200+ realistic DRO entries across multiple industries

### Security Requirements
- SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
- AES-256 encryption for static and transmitted data
- Third-party KYC/AML integration (Jumio, Trulioo)
- GDPR and CCPA compliance
- AWS WAF for firewall and intrusion detection
- Annual penetration testing

### Infrastructure
- **Cloud**: AWS or Azure hosting with load balancing
- **Architecture**: Microservices for modular functionality
- **Performance**: Page load time < 2 seconds, support 10,000+ concurrent users
- **Backup**: Automated DuckDB backups to Cloudflare R2 storage

## Core Platform Components

### S-Terminal (æ²™æ•¸é€šçµ‚ç«¯)
The proprietary trading platform providing DRO trading and portfolio management, similar to MCEX's M-Terminal.

### User Management System
- Registration, login, profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) with OTP and app-based authentication
- KYC/AML compliance checks for institutional investors and MSMEs

### DRO Trading Engine
- DRO listing, trading, and management
- Real-time trading data and analytics
- Revenue distribution and withdrawal system
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)

### Analytics & Reporting
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Portfolio performance reports
- Transaction detail reports
- Revenue distribution reports
- Multi-dimensional analysis (industry, geography, time trends)

## API Integrations

### Payment Systems
- Stripe, PayPal integration for multi-currency settlement
- Revenue collection and distribution

### Broker Integration
- RESTful API and WebSocket support for real-time trading data
- Third-party trading management

### External Data Sources
- Real-time revenue data API from MSME sources
- Third-party analytics tools (Tableau) integration

## API Authentication

### User Authentication (JWT)
For web application users:
```bash
# Register/Login to get JWT token
curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/auth/register \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"user@example.com","password":"password123",...}'

# Use JWT token in requests
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  http://localhost:3001/api/dro
```

### API Token Authentication
For batch operations and automation:

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

SIREX (Sand in River EX, æ²™æ•¸é€š) is a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs (Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises). The platform facilitates trading of Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) - standardized financial instruments representing economic and legal rights to a percentage of MSME daily revenues.

## Environment Details

- **Frontend URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/
- **Backend API**: https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript and Vite build system
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with navy blue & light gray color scheme
- **Design System**: Glass morphism effects with navy blue gradients and modern fintech aesthetics
- **UI Components**: Enhanced investment cards, VCTooltip system, MarketIndicators
- **Animations**: Micro-animations with staggered fadeInUp effects for premium user experience
- **Features**: AI-powered recommendations, smart filtering, real-time market data
- **Production URL**: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com/

### Backend Stack
- **Runtime**: Node.js with Express framework
- **API**: RESTful API architecture at https://sirex-api.onrender.com/api
- **Database**: DuckDB with comprehensive DRO and user management
- **Authentication**: JWT for user sessions, API tokens for batch operations
- **CORS**: Configured to allow sirex-frontend.onrender.com access
- **Data**: 200+ realistic DRO entries across multiple industries

### Security Requirements
- SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
- AES-256 encryption for static and transmitted data
- Third-party KYC/AML integration (Jumio, Trulioo)
- GDPR and CCPA compliance
- AWS WAF for firewall and intrusion detection
- Annual penetration testing

### Infrastructure
- **Cloud**: AWS or Azure hosting with load balancing
- **Architecture**: Microservices for modular functionality
- **Performance**: Page load time < 2 seconds, support 10,000+ concurrent users
- **Backup**: Automated DuckDB backups to Cloudflare R2 storage

## Core Platform Components

### S-Terminal (æ²™æ•¸é€šçµ‚ç«¯)
The proprietary trading platform providing DRO trading and portfolio management, similar to MCEX's M-Terminal.

### User Management System
- Registration, login, profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) with OTP and app-based authentication
- KYC/AML compliance checks for institutional investors and MSMEs

### DRO Trading Engine
- DRO listing, trading, and management
- Real-time trading data and analytics
- Revenue distribution and withdrawal system
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)

### Analytics & Reporting
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Portfolio performance reports
- Transaction detail reports
- Revenue distribution reports
- Multi-dimensional analysis (industry, geography, time trends)

## API Integrations

### Payment Systems
- Stripe, PayPal integration for multi-currency settlement
- Revenue collection and distribution

### Broker Integration
- RESTful API and WebSocket support for real-time trading data
- Third-party trading management

### External Data Sources
- Real-time revenue data API from MSME sources
- Third-party analytics tools (Tableau) integration

## API Authentication

### User Authentication (JWT)
For web application users:
```bash
# Register/Login to get JWT token
curl -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/auth/register \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"user@example.com","password":"password123",...}'

# Use JWT token in requests
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" \
  http://localhost:3001/api/dro
```

### API Token Authentication
For batch operations and automation:
```bash
# Using X-API-Key header
curl -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"dros":[...]}'

# Using Authorization header
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -X POST http://localhost:3001/api/dro/batch \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"dros":[...]}'
```

### Public Endpoints (No Auth Required)
- `GET /health` - Health check
- `GET /` - API info
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs (public read)
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Platform statistics

### Environment Variables
```bash
# Required for API token authentication
SIREX_API_TOKEN=your_api_token_here
```

## Development Commands

### Frontend Commands (client/)
```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Development server (runs on port 5173/5174)
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build

# Preview production build
npm run preview

# Type checking
npx tsc --noEmit
```

### Backend Commands (src/)
```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Development server
npm run dev

# Production server
npm start

# Database operations
node src/scripts/import200DROs.ts  # Import demo data
```

## Demo Users & Testing

### Demo Account Credentials
- **Demo Investor Account**:
  - Email: `investor@demo.com`
  - Password: `demo123456`
  - Type: Investor account for testing investment flows

- **Demo MSME Account**:
  - Email: `msme@demo.com` 
  - Password: `demo123456`
  - Type: MSME account for testing DRO creation and management

### Sample Data Import
```bash
# Import 200 sample DROs for testing
node add-200-dros-via-api.js

# Alternative: Direct database import
node database/import-200-dros.js
npx ts-node src/scripts/import200DROs.ts
```

## Database Backup & Recovery

### Cloudflare R2 Configuration
The system uses Cloudflare R2 for automated database backups. Configure these environment variables in your `.env` file:

```bash
# Cloudflare R2 Settings (required for backup/restore)
BACKUP_ENABLED=true
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCOUNT_ID=your_account_id
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_access_key_id
CLOUDFLARE_R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_secret_access_key
CLOUDFLARE_R2_BUCKET_NAME=your_bucket_name
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ENDPOINT=https://your_account_id.r2.cloudflarestorage.com

# Cloudflare API Token (optional, for direct API access)
CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN=your_api_token
```

**Development Environment**:
- **Bucket Name**: sirex-dev
- **Location**: Asia-Pacific (APAC)
- **S3 API Endpoint**: https://ed01ccea0b8ee7138058c4378cc83e54.r2.cloudflarestorage.com/sirex-dev
- **Created**: July 1, 2025

**Setup Instructions**:
1. Create a Cloudflare R2 bucket for SIREX backups
2. Generate API tokens with read/write permissions for your bucket
3. Add the credentials to your `.env` file (never commit to git)
4. Set `BACKUP_ENABLED=true` to enable automatic backups

**Required Permissions**: Read, write, and list objects in your designated backup bucket

### Backup Management Commands
```bash
# List available backups
node backup-cli.js list

# Create manual backup
node backup-cli.js backup

# Restore from latest backup
node backup-cli.js restore

# Force restore (overwrites local database)
node backup-cli.js restore --force

# Check backup system status
node backup-cli.js status
```

### Automatic Backup System
- **Smart Restore**: Automatically restores from R2 if local database is missing
- **Shutdown Backup**: Creates backup automatically when server shuts down
- **Timestamp Protection**: Prevents overwriting newer local data with older backups
- **Development Safe**: Preserves local development work during restore operations

## Design System & UI Components

### Color Scheme
- **Primary**: Navy Blue (#1e3a8a) with gradients to slate gray (#475569)
- **Secondary**: Light Gray (#f8fafc) to (#64748b) 
- **Background**: Navy blue gradient (#1e3a8a â†’ #334155 â†’ #64748b)
- **Accent Colors**: Gold (#f59e0b), Green (#10b981), Red (#ef4444)

### Key Components
- **VCTooltip**: VC-friendly explanatory tooltips for demo presentations
- **MarketIndicators**: TAM data visualization ($1.2T global SME market)
- **Enhanced DROCards**: Premium badges, micro-animations, visual hierarchy
- **Glass Morphism**: Backdrop blur effects with navy blue transparency

### Animation System
- **Staggered Animations**: fadeInUp with delay-based sequencing
- **Hover Effects**: Scale transforms and glow effects
- **Micro-interactions**: Button state changes and loading states

## API Integration & CORS

### API Configuration
```bash
# Environment variables
VITE_API_URL=https://sirex-api.onrender.com
```

### CORS Requirements (Backend)
```javascript
const cors = require('cors');
app.use(cors({
  origin: ['https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com', 'http://localhost:5173'],
  credentials: true,
  methods: ['GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'OPTIONS'],
  allowedHeaders: ['Content-Type', 'Authorization']
}));
```

## Regulatory Compliance

### Taiwan Financial Regulations
- Financial Supervision Act compliance
- Cross-border transaction legal framework evaluation

### International Compliance
- Anti-Money Laundering (AML) laws
- Customer Due Diligence (CDD) requirements
- EU GDPR for cross-border data protection
- US SEC regulations for cross-border DRO trading

## Multi-language Support

Platform supports:
- Traditional Chinese (ç¹é«”ä¸­æ–‡)
- English
- Japanese (æ—¥æ–‡)
- Portuguese (è‘¡è„ç‰™æ–‡)

## Performance Requirements

- **Availability**: 99.9% uptime (excluding planned maintenance)
- **Transactions**: Support 1,000+ transactions per second during peak periods
- **Daily Volume**: Handle 100,000 daily transactions
- **User Base**: Support 50,000 registered users
- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 compliance

# SIREX UI/UX Modernization Plan
## Crypto/Fintech Website Design Transformation

### ðŸŽ¯ **Project Overview**
Transform the current SIREX platform from a basic interface into a modern, professional crypto/fintech website with card-based layouts, enhanced visual appeal, and improved user experience.

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Phase 1: Design System & Foundation**

### 1.1 Color Palette & Branding
- [ ] **Primary Colors**: Crypto-inspired blue gradients (#0EA5E9 â†’ #8B5CF6)
- [ ] **Accent Colors**: Gold (#F59E0B), Green (#10B981), Red (#EF4444)
- [ ] **Dark Theme**: Deep navy backgrounds (#0F172A, #1E293B)
- [ ] **Neutral Colors**: Modern grays for text and borders

### 1.2 Typography & Spacing
- [ ] **Font Stack**: Inter/System fonts for modern readability
- [ ] **Typography Scale**: Consistent heading hierarchy
- [ ] **Spacing System**: 8px grid system for consistent layouts

### 1.3 Visual Effects
- [ ] **Gradients**: Crypto-inspired background gradients
- [ ] **Shadows**: Subtle card shadows with glow effects
- [ ] **Animations**: Smooth hover transitions and micro-interactions
- [ ] **Glass Morphism**: Semi-transparent card overlays

---

## ðŸ“‹ **Phase 2: Enhanced Card Designs**

### 2.1 DRO Cards (Investment Opportunities)
- [ ] **Card Structure**: Modern glass-morphism design
- [ ] **Progress Bars**: Animated funding progress with gradients
- [ ] **Status Badges**: Color-coded with rounded corners
- [ ] **Hover Effects**: Lift animation with enhanced shadows
- [ ] **Industry Icons**: Custom crypto-style iconography
- [ ] **Metrics Display**: Clean grid layout for key numbers
- [ ] **Action Buttons**: Gradient backgrounds with hover states

### 2.2 Dashboard Cards
- [ ] **Portfolio Cards**: Investment summary with charts
- [ ] **Performance Cards**: ROI and return visualizations
- [ ] **Quick Action Cards**: Primary actions with icons
- [ ] **Statistics Cards**: Key metrics with visual indicators

### 2.3 Navigation Cards
- [ ] **Menu Items**: Card-based navigation elements
- [ ] **User Profile**: Avatar with status indicators
- [ ] **Notification Cards**: Alert styling with priorities

content.text:
## âœ… **Mobile Spinner Issue Fixed!**

### ðŸ”§ **Problem Identified:**
The `animate-spin` class wasn't working on mobile because the custom Tailwind config was missing the default `spin` animation and keyframe definitions.

### ðŸ› ï¸ **Solution Applied:**
- âœ… Added `spin` animation to Tailwind config (`spin 1s linear infinite`)
- âœ… Added corresponding `spin` keyframe (`rotate(0deg)` to `rotate(360deg)`)
- âœ… Rebuilt frontend with updated configuration
- âœ… Committed and pushed the fix

### ðŸ“± **Impact:**
- **Mobile DRO browsing page**: Spinner now rotates properly during loading
- **All loading states**: `animate-spin` class works correctly across devices
- **User experience**: Improved visual feedback on mobile devices

### ðŸš€ **Next Steps:**
The fix has been deployed. The mobile spinner should now rotate properly when:
- Loading DROs on the home page
- Refreshing investment data
- Processing any loading states

**The mobile spinner rotation issue is now resolved!** ðŸŽ‰
